intro: Desmocladus lateriflorus, commonly known as the side-flowered desmocladus, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. Its adaptations to drought include reduced leaf surface area and the ability to store water in its thick, fleshy tissues. Desmocladus lateriflorus is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to environments with low rainfall.
